name: Porcelain Tea Cupping Set
description:
Run your own professional tea tastings with this Cupping Set. 

Professional tea tasting, or "cupping," is an essential practice common throughout the tea trade for evaluating the sensory characteristics of tea, including aroma, flavour and infusion colour. Comparing teas side-by-side in multiple Cupping Sets offers consistency, ensuring that tea tasters can fairly evaluate and compare tea samples. The lidded cup is designed to capture the aromas of tea and offer a dense snapshot of the tea's aromatic profile. The bowl, made of clear white porcelain, highlights the true infusion colours of tea.

name: Tea and Food Evenings
description:
Pairing 5 courses of food with teas of different origin and taste notes.

A sumptuous affair on your tables,  in a surrounding that is both vibrant and relaxed.

The focus of the food is freshness along with provenance. Most of the ingredients being organic, seasonal and from local farms. 


The teas are delivered after each course, and are positioned to finish the previous dish, or to open the palate for the next.
 
The evening begins at 19:30 with the first course served at 20:00
 
Tea and Food evenings are held at: 

Waterloo Tea at The Washington
1-3 Washington Buildings
Stanwell Road
Penarth
CF64 2AD

Please click on the drop-down down list and choose the relevant dates. 

Vouchers can be purchased as gifts. The recipient can telephone to book onto a specific night of their choosing.

The evenings are priced at £35 per person.

Specific dietary needs are lovingly catered for. Please contact us E: washington@waterlootea.com 
T: 029 2070 9158 
with any requirements.

name: Afternoon Tea Vouchers
description:
Comprising of a three tier cake stand filled with finger sandwiches, freshly baked scones with clotted cream and jam, cakes, and a pot of tea each.
It is also the only way to reserve a table at the teahouse. 

Everything is prepared fresh. When you arrive at the teahouse you choose the cakes you would like to go on the stand along with the teas that you would like to try.

For larger reservations, please telephone on 02920 456073.

Note : Champagne Afternoon Tea option available in Penarth branch.

Always served with love.

name: 12 month tea subscription
description:
Every month we will send you 50g loose leaf tea. Along with the tea will be an information leaflet that will describe the tea in detail, including the region of harvest, processing method and flavour profile. 

The tea will arrive in a resealable stand up pouch, ensuring its freshness for months to come. As always, brewing instructions will be on the labelling.

The tea we send will always be something we are proud of, and a representation of what we stand for. We will honour your commitment to us by offering you teas before they become available to the general public. We are very focused on seasonality and freshness, and the subscription teas will all be current season.

Over the course of the 12 months you will be delivered a range of teas that will encompass quality and range. 

The price includes Postage and Packaging for UK mainland deliveries only. There is a £50 charge for overseas orders.

The tea will be dispatched on the 2nd Wednesday of each month.

name: 6 Month Tea Subscription
description:
Every month we will send you 50g of loose leaf tea. Along with the tea will be an information leaflet that will describe the teas in detail, including the region of harvest, processing method and flavour profile. 

The tea will arrive in a resealable stand up pouch, ensuring its freshness for months to come. As always, brewing instructions will be on the labelling.

The tea we send will always be something we are proud of, and a representation of what we stand for. We will honour your commitment to us by offering you teas before they become available to the general public. We are very focused on seasonality and freshness, and the subscription teas will all be current season.

Over the course of the 6 months you will be delivered a range of teas that will encompass quality and range.

The price includes Postage and Packaging for UK mainland deliveries only. There is a £25 charge for overseas orders.

The tea will be dispatched on the 2nd Wednesday of every month.

name: Tea for Two set
description:
The classic stump teapot with two Japanese style teacups. 
Available in three colours.

name: Sowden Pot
description:
Our best pot. Offering near full immersion brew with a large infuser that allows leaves to fully unfurl and expand.
Designed by our friend George Sowden.

Great for brewing coffee also (they are actually coffee pots - with the micro holes being small enough to prevent coffee from passing through)

name: Large Stump Teapots
description:
Fantastic teapots that we use in the teahouse. We love them because they look good, are durable and most importantly - allow you to brew tea perfectly. With large stainless steel infusers that can be removed once the tea has brewed to the desired strength.
Made by a Japanese designer they bridge the gap between East and West.
Available in a variety of colours with matching Japanese tea cups and infuser dishes.
530ml
Gift boxed

name: Small Stump Teapots
description:
Fantastic teapots that we use in the teahouse. We love them because they look good, are durable and most importantly - allow you to brew tea perfectly. With large stainless steel infusers that can be removed once the tea has brewed to the desired strength.
Made by a Japanese designer they bridge the gap between East and West.

Perfect size for tea for one.
440ml. 

Gift Boxed

name: Infuser Dish
description:
Designed by the same company that makes the Stump teapots. 

These infuser dishes are the perfect accessory to the Stump. Tea should be brewed for a set amount of time. The teapots are great as they have a removable infuser - which holds all the tea. 

These dishes provide a perfect place for you to place the infuser onto when the tea has brewed.

Can also be used with other infusers, such as the infuser ball.

name: Infuser with dish
description:
We brew our take away tea using this, and also use it at home when we are making tea for one. The hook on the end of the stainless steel infuser allows it to hang from the side of your mug. The infuser is large enough to brew good quality whole leaf tea, unlike many lower grade infusers in this class.
When you have brewed the tea, you simply turn the infuser upside down and with one tap the leaves fall out. With no moving parts this will be with you for years to come.

name: Infuser ball
description:
The classic infuser ball. The chamber is large enough to effectively brew loose leaf tea. 
Great for those being introduced to tea.

name: 3, 4 & 5 Minute Sand Timer
description:
Brew your teas to perfection.
As used in the Teahouse.

name: 3, 5 & 7 Minute Sand Timer
description: Great way of brewing teas to perfection. The 7 minute sand timer is particularly useful for herbal infusions.

name: Finum Tea Filters
description:
Finum filters are internationally renown. The variety of 
sizes give each tea enthusiast the chance to enjoy their 
tea in their individually preferred manner. 

All filters have a  long fill-in-flap, which makes it it easier to fill 
with tea. The flap is also used to fix the filter at the rim 
of your tea pot by closing the lid.
All the filters have a pleated bottom which expands as the 
tea leaves unfurl for full their bodied flavour. 

Finum tea filters are made of biodegradable cellulose and manilla 
hemp. The oxygen bleached paper is famous for its 
unique true-flavour filtering qualities.

Slim - for cups and small pots
Large - for very large leaf tea, pots.

name: Aeropress
description:
The quickest and most consistent way to brew filter coffee. No fuss, no drama.Full immersion brew which leads to a fuller bodied infusion that other filter methods.
Easy to clean, durable.
A must have for all coffee enthusiasts.

name: Coffee Barista Course
description:
NOTE:
December and January are sold out. Should you wish to arrange a private session - please contact on info@waterlootea.com

This course will cover all elements of espresso machine use from how to adjust your grinder, tamping technique, pulling top espresso, milk preparation and espresso machine maintenance. It will leave you heading for home packed with enthusiasm for producing great tasting drinks!

Ideal for coffee connoisseurs and those employed in Cafes.

Priced at £40 per person. Light food is included.  

The course will begin at 6.00pm.


Love Coffee?
Learn Coffee.

name: Coffee Barista Skills Course Gift Voucher
description:
This course will cover all elements of espresso machine use from how to adjust your grinder, tamping technique, pulling top espresso, milk preparation and espresso machine maintenance. It will leave you heading for home packed with enthusiasm for producing great tasting drinks!

All courses are priced at £40 per person. Light food is included.  On receipt of the voucher, you can email to register for forthcoming barista  courses.  They will be held every two months.

Love Coffee?
Learn Coffee.

name: Japanese Teacups I
description:
Cups to match the Stump teapots.
Inspired by a Japanese designer, they carry the classic feature of having no handle. This is because Japanese teas are usually brewed at below 70 Degrees Celsius, hence the cups are never too hot to hold.
Available in a variety of colours.
(Set of two cups)

name: Japanese Teacups II
description:
Cups to match the Stump teapots.
Inspired by a Japanese designer, they carry the classic feature of having no handle. This is because Japanese teas are usually brewed at below 70 Degrees Celsius, hence the cups are never too hot to hold.
Available in a variety of colours.
(set of two)

name: Golden Yunnan
description:
Harvested from Yunnan's ancient tea trees. Golden Yunnan has expertly oxidised, evenly graded leaves and big, golden buds.

Tasting Notes: A full-flavoured and rich body with notes of peppery spice, chocolate, sweet raisin, and a malty finish.

Takes milk well. Delicious black.

name: Fujian Black
description:
A black tea from Fu Ding country, Fujian province. Harvested in April 2013. Commonly known as Bai Lin Gong Fu.

Varietal Fu Ding Xiao Bai Hao.
Made from the buds of the tea plant.
Full bodied, with notes of sweet caramel.

name: Yunnan Breakfast
description: Our premium single estate breakfast tea has a robust and flavourful taste profile that is rich and malty with subtle notes of chocolate. A pure Dian Hong style black tea harvested from Yunnan’s antique tea trees.

name: Keemun
description: Developed in the mid 1800s with small leaf tea bush varietals native to eastern and central China, Keemun is one of the classic black teas. It is cherished for its smooth, semisweet flavour and its subtle smoky and rich pine aroma.

name: Darjeeling First Flush Glenburn Estate
description: A well crafted tea with a beautiful bloom and an abundance of silver tips. Made from only the finest tender shoots plucked from the non-clonal sections during the onset of spring at Glenburn. The liquor is light and bright, smooth on the palate with undertones of citrus flowers and peach. Full of aroma, it personifies all the attributes of a quality first flush tea.

name: Meghalaya Autumn - LaKyrsiew, The Awakening
description:
This is a delicate yet rich infusion from the state of Meghalaya which sits between Darjeeling and Assam. Originally designated for tea production when the British arrived 200 years, the plans were shelved and only revived in 2002 (Lakyrsiew translates as 'Awakening'). Since then, they have been producing teas of the highest quality, reaching huge figures at auction. A true connoisseurs tea. Opening with subtlety and sweetness , followed by rich notes of chocolate and caramel.
The Autumn harvest being our favourite, we have exclusively purchased it in 2011 and again in 2012

name: Assam Mokalbari East TGFOP1
description:
A farm that is close to our hearts due to the profile of the teas that it produces. Rich, Malty, Sweet - all the characteristics that people normally expect from good quality Assam. 

Takes milk well, with the tea cutting through and not being lost.

In our opinion, this is the benchmark to compare other Assam tea against.

name: Ceylon Kataboola
description:
This is one of the most outstanding Ceylon teas you will ever drink: full bodied, soothing and complex. Harvested in the Summer, this tea offers a clean, wiry and black leaf. The liquor shows character and depth in the classical sense of Ceylon teas.
Although it takes milk well, it is best drunk black.

This Ceylon is composed of long whole leaf from Kataboola estate, which is in the central province of Sri Lanka, at an elevation of 1021 metres above sea level. In 1972, the island then known as Ceylon reverted to the traditional name of Sri Lanka, but retained the name of Ceylon for the marketing of teas.

name: Waterloo Blend, Organic
description: An exquisite balance of rich strength and light fragrant qualities. Our blend of a premium Assam with 2nd flush Darjeeling is more than just a 'house tea'. With long, golden tips, jet black leaves and an empowering aroma, this tea offers the perfect balance of a rich and malty Indian tea, married with delicate fragrance and softness. Perfect as a breakfast or afternoon tea. Takes milk well.

name: Waterloo Breakfast
description: Our own blend of Assam and Sumatra Teas. More robust than Waterloo Blend it is the tea of choice for those wanting a strong pick me up. Smooth and malty it is an ideal first step away from English Breakfast.

name: English Breakfast
description: A special version of this classic blend using Golden Broken Orange Pekoe teas. These are produced in the traditional ‘orthodox’ way, where leaves are rolled to release the flavour. The taste is full bodied, rich and refreshing, with a bright and inviting colour. Takes milk well.

name: Decaffeinated Breakfast
description:
This is a flavoursome, rich blend of African teas for those who want to watch their caffeine intake.
It’s decaffeinated by a natural CO2 process that does not use any chemicals. This reduces the level of caffeine to 0.2% without losing any of the flavour.

name: Waterloo Chai
description:
This is a perfect example of what Chai should be, a blend of fine whole leaf Ceylon tea
with cardamom pods, star anise, cloves and cinnamon sticks. The resulting tea has a spicy flavour and
sweet aroma.

When you order chai at the teahouse, it takes us about 8 minutes to get it ready for you. We prepare it in the traditional way by adding water and milk, and leaving to simmer until it takes that gorgeous golden brown colour. We were tempted to throw in shovels of sugar, but we’ll let you do that!

name: Vanilla Black
description:
Decadent and creamy with the sweet enchanting flavour of real vanilla.
Vanilla is the bean-shaped seedpod of an orchid vine indigenous to Veracruz in Mexico and has an ancient history as an Aztec medicine and aphrodisiac. Organic vanilla pods are used in the blend of this tea.

name: Earl Grey
description: A British tea classic. This citrus-scented tea blend dates back to the 19th Century Sino-British trade of opium, tea, silk and porcelain. Our Earl Grey blends bold flavoured Yunnan Dian Hong harvested from antique tea trees with natural Bergamot citrus from Sicily.

name: Waterloo Christmas
description: Our spiced Christmas tea is a blend of black teas with tangy lemon peels, fruity orange peels and mellow, warming cinnamon.

name: Hubei Cloud
description: A special grade of Chinese green tea produced in the high elevation tea gardens of western Hubei. Each year, our Hubei Cloud is carefully selected from the farmers’ earliest batches of spring tea. A mellow and refreshing character that is smooth with low astringency. It's aroma suggests sweetly toasted chestnut and meadow grass.

name: Dragon Well
description: Our Dragon Well is mellow and smooth with a fresh finish and roasted chestnut aroma. Dragon Well (Long Jing) is the most famous Chinese green tea, named after the Dragon’s Well landmark in the West lake area of the Zhejiang, where the tea originated. A pan-fired green tea that is flat fried by hand in large woks. It is performed one small batch at a time according to an artisan processing technique that yields a tea with leaves shaped like the blade of a sword.

name: Ancient Emerald Lily
description: A beautiful tea to look at and to taste. Emerald Lily has a brisk, fresh flavour that is well balanced with aromatic notes of wildflowers and toasted pine nuts. This unique green tea is hand harvested especially from Yunnan’s old growth forest tea trees. Green tea from Yunnan’s old growth trees contains a higher content of polyphenols and natural tea antioxidants than other green teas.

name: Mao Jian
description:
Zhe Jiang Mao Jian. 
Harvested in March 2013. The top harvest of the season. 
Produced in Li Shui city in Zhe Jian province,
From the Long Jing 43 varietal.
We are putting this forward as our top Chinese green of 2013. Beautifully processed. An umami normally associated with japanese greens.

A must have.

name: Orange Blossom
description: Orange Blossom is a refreshing and floral blend of green teas with sweetly-scented blossoms, lemongrass and tropical citrus fruits.

name: Mint Green
description: Moroccan Mint is a premium version of a classic green tea blend enjoyed throughout the world. This blend combines the finest organic peppermint, with floral-scented, Chinese green tea.

name: Jasmine Green
description: Green tea blended with fresh jasmine blossoms by a traditional tea scenting process. The green tea absorbs the natural essence from fresh jasmine blossoms and imparts a sweet and soothing fragrance in every cup.

name: Jasmine Pearl
description: The most tender green tealeaves and silvery down-covered buds are hand rolled into small pearls and naturally scented with the essence of fresh jasmine blossoms. The fragrant blossoms are mixed with a reserve Dragon Pearl several times until it becomes infused with the sweet flavour and heady aroma of real jasmine. More than 10 kilos of fresh jasmine flowers are used to scent each kilo of dried Dragon Pearl green tea.

name: Sencha, Organic
description: This is the most beloved tea of Japan. Developed in the 18th century, the process of making Sencha has evolved into the art and science of preserving the fresh green character and healthy components of tealeaves. Our Sencha is organically cultivated in Kagoshima, Japan, where the beneficial climate, rich volcanic soil and abundant hot springs give the tea a deep juicy flavour.

name: Nishi 1st flush
description:
Nishi-San was a pioneer of organic farming in Japan. His family farm have gained great expertise in nurturing the Yabukita and other cultivars.
This first flush Sencha is a light steamed type (asamushi) from the first harvest of spring when the highest quality of tea is produced.

Refreshing and brisk with a famed bitter-sweet flavour and deep umami.

name: Kukicha
description:
Kukicha is noted for its fresh green flavour and low astringency. Our Kukicha has an emerald green infusion, with the classic bitter-sweet notes and mouthfeel associated with fine Japanese teas.

Origin Kagoshima, Japan.

name: Houjicha
description:
A classic style of Japanese green,made with roasted leaves from the autumn and winter harvests.

An Amber infusion with note of chocolate and roasted barley

name: Sencha Sakura (Cherry Blossom)
description: Sakura is the ubiquitous flowering cherry tree planted in Japanese parks, along streets and within commons and yards. During late March through May, Sakura blooms across Japan. The Hanami festival celebrates the coming of the spring season and is the time to take a stroll and view the blooming cherry trees. The cherry blossom symbolizes feminine beauty, the feminine principle and love in the language of herbs. Cherry blossoms, with their short blooming times, are believed to represent the transient nature of life. Sencha Sakura is a blend of Sakura cherry flowers and the specially cured leaves of Sakura cherry trees, which accentuate the smooth, sweet and refreshing character of our deep-steamed Sencha. This blend is made without any oils or flavourings.

name: Genmaicha
description: The original type of genmaicha was developed hundreds of years ago by Zen monks who mixed green tea with the browned rice stuck to the bottom of their cauldrons. Soon after, roasted rice was blended with sencha or bancha by tea vendors throughout Japan where it became a popular household green. Genmaicha is smooth and mild with a warming and toasty aroma.

name: Matcha, High Grade. Kyoto.
description:
Surprisingly sweet, slightly grassy and almost tangibly nourishing. Matcha is the powdered bright green tea traditionally used in the Japanese tea ceremony. Made from leaves with the highest concentration of caffeine of any plant, this verdant brew gives a real buzz while remaining miraculously healthy. Used by Zen Buddhist monks to stay awake for meditation weeks, and by Japanese students cramming for exams, it is now spreading to the West mainly in the form of the matcha latte. Its concentrated power comes from the way it is grown. Matcha is made of the tips of budding tea-bushes that have been shaded with bamboo mats for three weeks of spring growth. This keeps the caffeine content high and preserves the chlorophyll (since the sunless leaves cannot undergo photosynthesis). The leaves are stone-ground to an ultra-fine powder and kept in the fridge. A further part of matcha’s kick is that you ingest the whole, ground-up tea rather than drinking a steeped brew poured off the leaves. The amino acid l-theanine, prominent in green tea and sold as a stress treatment in Japan, is one reason tea-caffeine has a different physiological effect than coffee-caffeine. It tends to give drinkers a calm energy rather than a jittery restlessness. 
Our high grade matcha from Kyoto is suitable for all purposes, including Japanese tea ceremonies and as a fine ingredient in foods.

name: White Peony
description: White Peony (Bai Mu Dan) is the most common style of traditional white tea and consists of two tealeaves and a silvery bud. Bai Mu Dan is prized for its smooth, sweet flavor and slightly woody, toasted aroma. Gentle processing and a unique withering process result in an amber-orange infusion with low astringency, weighty mouth-feel and a mild flavour that pairs well with most foods.

name: Silver Needle
description: Silver Needle is the premium grade of classic white tea and consists only of the first flush spring buds of the tea plant. Our Silver Needles are hand harvested from Fujian’s unique Fuding Da Hao varietal that is prized for its large silvery buds and delicious sweet flavour.

name: Yunnan White Buds
description:
This is one of our premier teas from the old growth tea forests of Yunnan. The unique aroma and flavour of this superior grade of sun-dried tea (Saiqing Ya Cha) can only be captured during one brief harvest between March and April and consists of only large, silvery-white bud tips from Yunnan’s broad leaf, antique tea trees. A rich honey-like flavor and floral, fruity finish unlike any other white tea we offer. 
Harvested March 2013 using the Yunnan Da Ye varietal

name: Hairy Monkey
description:
Also known as Fu Ding Bai Mao Hou. An exceptional April 2013 harvest. Originating from Fujian Province, it is grown from the same culitvar used in the production of Silver Needle.

Incredibly sweet and floral, with an umami not normally associated with this processing method.

name: White Peach Blossom
description: White teas hand blended with the natural essences of succulent peaches and tangerines. The flavour of sweet peaches is well balanced with accents of fresh citrus and white tea character.

name: White Mandarin Citrus
description: White teas hand blended with Australian lemon myrtle leaf, mandarin orange, jasmine and grapefruit. Smooth and refreshing white tea flavour in balance with fresh citrus and a complex flowery aroma.

name: Spring Season Oolong
description: This lightly oxidized oolong tea from the mountainous region of Nantou, Taiwan, has a smooth golden green infusion enjoyed by green tea lovers. Its flowery aroma, brisk flavour, smooth body and fruity finish make this one of our favourite oolongs.  Spring harvest. (This is a light roast, compared to our Iron Goddess of Mercy, which is a medium roast)

name: Iron Goddess of Mercy Oolong
description:
Tae Kuan Yin is known as Iron Goddess of Mercy and is the most famous oolong tea. Our special grade of this tea is hand-harvested from the soft stem Wu-Yi tea bush cultivar that is descended from the original tea bushes introduced to Taiwan from Fujian in the 19th Century. 
Made according to the traditional Tae Kuan Yin oxidation and bamboo coal baking techniques developed in China’s Fujian province. 
A light golden-amber infusion with a smooth body and sweet finish. Its aroma is profoundly reminiscent of baked grain and dried apricot.

name: Yellow Gold
description:
Also known as Golden Osthmanthus or Huang Jin Gui Oolong.

Harvested in mid April 2013 from Zhang Zhou in Fujian province.
The varietal used is the Huang dan (Huang jin gui).

The Osmanthus flower flavour is prominent. Delivers a light and refreshing flavour

name: Phoenix Orchid
description:
Also known as Milan Dancong

Along with Oriental Beauty this is one of the most prized open oolongs.
Rich with honey and lychee notes. 
As with all oolongs, this can be re-infused multiple times 

Harvested in late March 2013. 
Produced from the Ba Ye Dancong varietal on the Feng Huang mountain in Guangdong province.

name: Wuyi Oolong
description:
The cliffs of Northern Fujian’s Wuyi Mountains are an important tea producing area with a long history. Oolong tea was first produced in Wuyi and this region’s soil type, microclimate and unique tea bushes produce exquisite oolong. 
Our Organic Wuyi Mountain Oolong has a smooth and rich body with a classical roasted aroma and sweet finish, Known as Wuyi Qi Lan or “Profound Orchid,” its flavour is quite unique with sweet notes of raisin sugar, honeysuckle and roasted barley. Organic Wuyi Mountain Oolong is great with any meal and makes superb cold tea for the summer season.

name: Da Yu Ling Oolong
description:
Distinctive mountain essence, fresh flower and evergreen notes, lingering refined sweetness.

Mouth Feel: Soft with light, smooth body
Aroma: Delicate, fresh, floral
Ingredients: Ching Shin Oolong
Oxidation/Fermentation: Light
Origin: Da Yu Ling, in one of the highest elevation tea farming areas of Central Taiwan
Elevation: 2,300 metres/7,545 feet

As with most oolongs, you can steep multiple times.

Steep first time for 50 seconds, second steep for 40 seconds, third steep for 50 seconds, fourth steep for 60 seconds, fifth steep for 70 seconds, sixth steep for 90 seconds and seventh steep for 2 minutes

name: Li Shan Oolong
description:
Distinctive mountain essence, notes of fresh flowers and fruits, lingering refined sweetness.

Mouth Feel: Soft with light and smooth body
Aroma: Delicate, fresh nectar with fruit notes
Ingredients: Ching Shin Oolong
Oxidation/Fermentation: Light
Origin: Li Shan, also known as Pear Mountain, one of the highest altitude tea farming regions in Central Taiwan
Elevation: 2,100 metres/6,889 feet

Steep first time for 50 seconds, second steep for 40 seconds, third steep for 50 seconds, fourth steep for 60 seconds, fifth steep for 70 seconds, sixth steep for 90 seconds and seventh steep for 2 minutes.

name: Mao Xie
description:
Also known as Hairy Crab oolong. 
A quality closed oolong with a full bodied taste. Combines the aroma of sugar cane with a floral taste

Harvested in late April 2013 from Zhang Zhou, Fujian province.

name: Yuzu Oolong
description: High altitude Ali shan oolong infused with natural pomelo peels, following the traditional method of layering tea leaves with natural flavouring. Intense citrus aroma with hints of oolong. Light and smooth body with a blend of zesty grapefruit and mellow oolong flavours. A firm favourite.

name: Puerh Ancient Shu Classic Vintage Blend
description:
Earthy, rich and smooth with the comforting aroma of autumn leaves.

Puerh tea is so different to other teas. Those that truly love Puerh tea find that its appeal is not just in its unique flavours and textures, but also in the way it soothes both mind and body. It has been touted as a weight loss miracle, originally by the Chinese and more recently by celebrities. Puerh teas can be aged for up to 50 years in humidity- and temperature-controlled conditions to produce teas that have a typically earthy, mature,
smooth flavour and aroma. The teas are named after Puerh city in Yunnan province which was once the main trading centre for teas made in the area.

name: Ancient Shu Puerh Tuo Cha
description:
Convenient, authentic and delicious. Classic style compressed Pu-erh hand-harvested from the antique tea trees of Mannong Manmai. Rich, full-bodied and smooth with a sweetly flavoured infusion rarely found in this type of tea. 

Simply unwrap and drop one of these cakes into a teapot or cup and let it infuse. In order to infuse, use 1 tuo per cup and infuse for 1 minute. Re-steep 5-7 times, reducing infusion time as tea unfurls fully.

name: Puerh Blood Orange
description: Based on an ancient and popular digestive tonic of Pu-erh aged with citrus and Asian grapefruit, this is a succulent and soothing blend of blood orange, organic roots, fruits and spices. With a heavy body, sweet flavour and crisp and refreshing citrus bite. The aroma and presence of blood orange and grapefruit are in perfect balance with the rich bodied Pu-erh.

name: Rooibos, Organic
description:
Rooibos is a nutritious herb with bountiful health benefits. Prepared like tea, its an all natural, caffeine free source of powerful antioxidants that can strengthen the body’s
natural immunity against ageing and disease. Rooibos contains Vitamin C and E as well as iron, zinc, potassium and calcium. It promotes restful sleep and relaxation. Devoid of bitterness it is naturally sweet without sugar. It grows only in specific microclimates of South Africa, and was originally drunk by the nomadic tribes inhabiting the Western Cape.
It is also known as African Red Bush.

name: Green Rooibos, Organic
description: African green rooibos is made with the same plant as the famous African Rooibos. After harvesting, green rooibos is not oxidised. The leaves and stems remain green, giving the infusion a bright orange colour with a unique earthy flavour and a sweet finish. It is lighter bodied than ‘red’ rooibos and is said to contain higher concentrations of antioxidants, vitamin and minerals.

name: Earl Grey Rooibos
description:
Rooibos makes the perfect base for the finest caffeine-free Earl Grey. Its sweet, deep red infusion presents fruity and floral notes of bergamot citrus without the astringency, bitterness and caffeine found in a common Earl Grey. Caffeine-free Earl Grey Rooibos is
artfully hand blended in small batches using only 100% naturally caffeine-free botanicals and artisan herbal tea blending techniques.

name: Ginger and Lime Rooibos
description: The delicious West Indian Lime variety gives our Ginger and Lime Rooibos a unique and zesty citrus flavour with notes of ginger and rare spices. The brilliant turmeric yellow and orange infusion glows in the cup and has wonderfully refreshing notes of tropical fruits and spices. The unique flavour of this rare lime variety is thirst quenching and known to enhance circulation and immunity. Get the juices flowing with this stimulating yet caffeine-free blend of antioxidant-rich and longevity-enhancing botanicals.

name: Peppermint Rooibos
description: Peppermint Rooibos has a deep red infusion with a fresh minty flavour and aroma. The rooibos in the blend completes the drink, rounding off the mint with a sweet edge. A firm favourite.

name: Orange and Lemon Rooibos, Organic
description: Rooibos, lemon peels, orange peels, lemongrass, natural flavour. Exotic orange-lemon-taste

name: Yerba Maté
description:
Yerba Maté is an indigenous herb of the Amazon and popular throughout Latin America for its robust flavour. It's often referred to as the "tea" of Latin America. Organic Yerba Maté is one of many potential renewable rainforest products and part of a socially and environmentally conscious movement known as "market driven conservation." This Yerba Maté is sustainable and shade grown from Argentina.

Contains caffeine and delivers uplifting energy.

name: Organic Lemongrass Mate
description:
Yerba Mate is an indigenous herb to the Amazon and popular throughout Latin America for its invigorating energy and robust flavour. It is rich in vitamins, minerals and antioxidants. Organic Yerba Mate is one of many potential renewable rainforest products and part of a socially and environmentally conscious movement known as ‘market driven conservation’
The combination of bittersweet Yerba Maté with organic lemongrass and organic lemon myrtle offers a strong infusion with smooth body and zesty citrus notes.

name: Hibiscus Berry
description: Luscious currants and delicious forest berries complement this fruity and balanced blend with a wonderful scarlet red infusion that refreshes and rejuvenates.

name: Cinnamon Spice
description: Cinnamon Spice is rich with currants, succulent hibiscus, hints of plum and accented with notes of cinnamon and naturally sweet liquorice root. Warm and soothing, Cinnamon Spice is deliciously fruity and full-bodied with a deep red infusion

name: Tangerine Ginger
description: Tangerine Ginger has a complex array of sweet, spicy, tart and fruity flavours. Stimulating ginger root and wild-harvested Schizandra berries are expertly balanced with the natural essential oils of citrus fruits, succulent tangerines and rare herbs. Tangerine Ginger is a full-bodied and invigorating blend with a wonderful gourmet flavour and aroma.

name: Cranberry Fruit
description: Rosehip fruits, hibiscus, apple pieces, carrot slices, mullein flowers, whole cranberries, whole cherries, rose petals, natural flavour (cranberry taste).

name: Organic Nettle
description: Nettles are a proven tonic to help cleanse the digestive system. They are also celebrated for helping to alleviate rheumatism and arthritic aches and pains.

name: Organic Lemon Verbena
description: Our Pure Organic Verbena is a naturally caffeine-free herbal infusion made with the finest certified organic vervaine leaves. Also known as Lemon Verbena, vervaine is a refreshing, delicately lemon-scented infusion. Fantastic for the digestive system, and perfect after lunch or dinner.

name: Organic Peppermint
description: Peppermint is proven to be calming and soothing to the digestive system. It gives a naturally caffeine-free, refreshing minty infusion far superior to any peppermint teabag on the market today.

name: Organic Chamomile
description: Cherished throughout the world for its calming and digestive properties. Our chamomile  gives a naturally caffeine-free, golden infusion with the aroma of blossoms and a clean fragrant taste.

name: Organic Fennel
description:
Fennel seeds are used in cooking the world over because of the wonderful liquorice sweet taste that is unique to fennel. But over and above this distinctive taste is the wonderful muscle relaxing properties of the oil from fennel seeds. The effect of fennel as
a muscle relaxant is well known and can be given to children to sooth digestion and wind pain. Also great for bloating, catarrh, for feeding mums, and as a diuretic.

name: Organic Elderflower
description:
100% natural organic Elderflower – aids calmness and promotes a good night’s sleep. Good for colds, influenza and hay fever.
Delicate elderflower takes one back to late summer with this light and fragrant infusion. A fine afternoon beverage, it can also be taken when cold and 'flu are in the vicinity.

name: Organic Rose Bud
description: Made with certified organic whole pink rosebuds and nothing else. It is proven to be soothing, relaxing and good for circulation. It gives a naturally caffeine-free, aromatic and delicately sweet floral infusion.
